alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Washtenaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 7:04AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Livingston and northern Washtenaw Counties through 745 AM EDT... At 704 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fowlerville to near Stockbridge to near Grass Lake. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fowlerville and Gregory around 710 AM EDT. Oak Grove around 715 AM EDT. Howell, Chelsea and Cohoctah around 720 AM EDT. Brighton, Dexter and Pinckney around 725 AM EDT. Hartland around 730 AM EDT. Hamburg and Whitmore Lake around 735 AM EDT. South Lyon around 740 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Plainfield, Hudson Mills Metropark, Island Lake State Recreation Area, Delhi Mills, Barton Hills, Conway Township, Pinckney State Recreation Area, Hudson Mills, Parkers Corners and Lakeland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
